ref: 3037 kāpaṭa ʻ fraudulent ʼ VarBr̥S. [Forms of G. < *kāpa- with -- ṭa -- , -- la -- , -- ta -- (or -- ka -- ), -- tra -- . Cf. Sk. Pa. kapaṭa -- m.n. ʻ fraud ʼ, Pk. kavaḍa -- n.: prob. ← Drav. cf. kūṭá -- 1 T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]
G. kāvṛũ ʻ roguish, ungrateful ʼ, kāval n. ʻ fraud ʼ, kāvɔ m., kāvatrũ n.; -- semant. more remote
S. kāvaṛi f. ʻ anger, passion ʼ, kāviṛaṇu ʻ to be angry ʼ;
G. kāvrũ ʻ excited, teased ʼ (but see kātara -- and *klāvyatē).
